Argument Capturing
[Sensor Placement]

Capturing Arguments passed to functions. More...


Modules

 Argument Capturing for Compilers not supporting Variadic Macros
 Capturing Arguments passed to functions.

Defines

#define DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE(...)   __DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE__(0, __VA_ARGS__)
 Places a sensor enabling argument capturing.
#define DYNATRACE_START_PUREPATH_CAPTURE(...)   __DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE__(1, __VA_ARGS__)
 Places a sensor enabling argument capturing and marks it as entry point.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_BOOL(argument)   dynatrace_capture_bool(__dynatrace_serial_no__, !!(argument))
 Captures a bool value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_CHAR(argument)   dynatrace_capture_char(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (char)(argument))
 Captures an ASCII char value (or EBCDIC on zOS).
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT16(argument)   dynatrace_capture_int16(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (dynatrace_int16_t)(argument))
 Captures an int16 value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT32(argument)   dynatrace_capture_int32(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (dynatrace_int32_t)(argument))
 Captures an int32 value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT64(argument)   dynatrace_capture_int64(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (dynatrace_int64_t)(argument))
 Captures an int64 value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_FLOAT(argument)   dynatrace_capture_float(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (float)(argument))
 Captures a float value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_DOUBLE(argument)   dynatrace_capture_double(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (double)(argument))
 Captures a double value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_STRING(argument)   dynatrace_capture_string(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (const char *)(argument))
 Captures a zero-terminated 7-bit ASCII (or EBCDIC on zOS) string value.
#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_STRING_WITH_CHARSET(argument, length, ccsid)   dynatrace_capture_string_with_charset(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (const char *)(argument), length, ccsid)
 Captures a string value of the specified length (in bytes) and charset (CCSID).

Detailed Description

Capturing Arguments passed to functions.

Remarks:
DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_xxx should only be used within any of DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE, DYNATRACE_START_PUREPATH_CAPTURE, Argument Capturing for Compilers not supporting Variadic Macros
void foo(int i, const char *cp, double d, boolean b) {
    DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE(
        DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT32(i),
        DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_STRING(cp),
        DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_DOUBLE(d),
        DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_BOOL(b)
    );
    ...
    DYNATRACE_EXIT();
}

Define Documentation

#define DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE ( ...   )     __DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE__(0, __VA_ARGS__)

Places a sensor enabling argument capturing.

See also:
Argument Capturing

DYNATRACE_START_PUREPATH_CAPTURE for marking this as entry point.

#define DYNATRACE_START_PUREPATH_CAPTURE ( ...   )     __DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE__(1, __VA_ARGS__)

Places a sensor enabling argument capturing and marks it as entry point.

See also:
Argument Capturing

DYNATRACE_ENTER_CAPTURE for placing a sensor and NOT marking is as entry point.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_BOOL ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_bool(__dynatrace_serial_no__, !!(argument))

Captures a bool value.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_CHAR ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_char(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (char)(argument))

Captures an ASCII char value (or EBCDIC on zOS).

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT16 ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_int16(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (dynatrace_int16_t)(argument))

Captures an int16 value.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT32 ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_int32(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (dynatrace_int32_t)(argument))

Captures an int32 value.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_INT64 ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_int64(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (dynatrace_int64_t)(argument))

Captures an int64 value.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_FLOAT ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_float(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (float)(argument))

Captures a float value.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_DOUBLE ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_double(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (double)(argument))

Captures a double value.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_STRING ( argument   )     dynatrace_capture_string(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (const char *)(argument))

Captures a zero-terminated 7-bit ASCII (or EBCDIC on zOS) string value.

Remarks:
The maximum string length captured depends on the dynaTrace Agent.

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE_STRING_WITH_CHARSET ( argument,
length,
ccsid   )     dynatrace_capture_string_with_charset(__dynatrace_serial_no__, (const char *)(argument), length, ccsid)

Captures a string value of the specified length (in bytes) and charset (CCSID).

Remarks:
The maximum string length captured depends on the dynaTrace Agent.
